cyclone.name: NICHOLAS
cyclone.current_location: about 70 miles SSE of Port Aransas, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: tracking generally north, then turning north-northeast along the Texas coast toward the central Texas coastline before moving inland across eastern Texas and toward Louisiana
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Texas coast near Matagorda/Port O’Connor area

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch from Port Aransas to San Luis Pass, TX; Storm Surge Watch from Baffin Bay to Port Aransas and Sabine Pass to Rutherford Beach, LA
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning from Mouth of the Rio Grande to Sabine Pass, TX; Storm Surge Warning Port Aransas to Sabine Pass including Galveston Bay and nearby bays
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southern and middle Texas coast, extending northward toward the upper Texas coast
weather_observation.wind: Only a very small chance (≤5%) of brief tropical-storm-force gusts; sustained tropical-storm winds are unlikely at Brownsville.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge of roughly 1–3 ft possible at the mouth of the Rio Grande and adjacent coast.
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of moderate to locally heavy rain could bring 2–4 inches through Tuesday; widespread totals >4 inches are not expected at Brownsville.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents along south Texas beaches.
